text: The Division of Menzies is an Australian Electoral Division in the state of Victoria. It is covers the suburbs of Bulleen, Croydon Hills, Doncaster, Doncaster East, Donvale, Park Orchards, Templestowe, Templestowe Lower, Warrandyte and Warrandyte South. There are also parts of Ringwood North, Warranwood and Wonga Park in the Division. The Division was set up in 1984. It was named after Rt Hon Sir Robert Menzies, the longest serving Prime Minister of Australia. ==Members== Member Party Term Neil Brown Liberal 1984–1991 Kevin Andrews Liberal 1991–present Kevin Andrews became the Minister for Social Services in the Abbott Government. ==Election results== ==References== ==Other websites== * Division of Menzies - Australian Electoral Commission Category:Electoral divisions of Victoria, Australia Category:1984 establishments in Australia
title: Division of Menzies
